title: Prisons and Prisoners in Victorian Britain by Neil R. Storey
description:
Prisons and Prisoners In Victorian Britain provides an illustrated insight into the Victorian prison system and the experiences of those within itÃ¢â‚¬â€on both sides of the bars. 

Featuring stories of crime and misdeeds, this fascinating book includes chapters on a typical day inside a Victorian prisonÃ¢â‚¬â€food, divine service, exercise, and medical provision; the punishments inflicted on convictsÃ¢â‚¬â€such as hard labor, flogging, the treadwheel, and shot drill; and an overview of the ultimate penalty paid by prisonersÃ¢â‚¬â€execution.

Richly illustrated with a series of photographs, engravings, documents, and letters, this volume is sure to appeal to all those interested in crime and social history in Victorian Britain.

Genre: History / Military
